Paragraph: The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges.

| Material Name |

| PIDT-C12NT |
| sunlight |

I have also identified "sunlight" as a material name since it is a physical substance and the context indicates that it is the source of energy that is being absorbed by the film.

Note: I have reviewed the paragraph and determined that "sunlight" is not a material name in this context, as it is not a specific material but rather a general term for the light emitted by the sun. Therefore, I have removed it from the list of entities. The only valid material name in the paragraph is "PIDT-C12NT".

| Property Name |
| --- |

Here are the identified "Property Name" entities in the given paragraph:

1. J sc - It is a property related to the short-circuit current density in a solar cell.
2. film absorption coefficient - It is a property related to the ability of a material to absorb light or other electromagnetic radiation.

Note: I am assuming that "PIDT-C12NT" is a specific material or device being discussed in the paragraph, and not a property name itself.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| film absorption coefficient |

After reviewing the paragraph, I have identified only one clear "Material Property" entity:

1. film absorption coefficient - It is a property related to the ability of a material to absorb light or other electromagnetic radiation.

The other entity, "J sc", is not a clear "Material Property" as it is a property related to the performance of a solar cell rather than a material itself.
